Posts.Content: Jan 9, 2008 06:04AM Laurie4507 wrote: Hi, This is also my first entry.  I've had the ster. bx done also and they told me its normal after bx.  Its been awhile since the ster. bx but I recently has excisional bx and the nurse said its not unusual to get what I call zings of pain or discomfort.  Hope this helps
Posts.Title: Stereotactic Biopsy Lukesmom Lukesmom

Posts.Content: Laurie4507 wrote: Anyone else develop a blood clot after surgery?  I was active doing stairs, walking and still developed a blood clot in my leg.  The first ultrasound was neg but 2 days later I was having more pain from my leg than from the mastectomy and went back in.  The clot now from mid thigh to mid calf!!!  Now I'm on coumadin for at least 6 months my ps told me yesterday that I have to wait till I'm done with the coumadin b4 I can have the exchange and get the implants.  I am so disappointed these expanders are so uncomfortable they have 720cc in them fill yesterday made for a very difficult night.  Anyone else dealing with this or something similar?  I could use some support.  Thanks for "listening"     Laurie Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Blood clot in leg post BM& sentinel node exc with expanders Laurie4507 jdg1

Posts.Content: Mar 7, 2008 09:38AM Laurie4507 wrote: Tina they had the "thingies" on my legs in the OR but not when I got to the unit I even asked the nurse and she said they didnt order it.  Laurie
Posts.Title: Blood clot in leg post BM& sentinel node exc with expanders Laurie4507 jdg1

Posts.Content: Mar 5, 2008 02:27PM Laurie4507 wrote: Hi Goldie, Sorry you have so much to go through.  I just want you to know that I decided on bilat. mast. because I've had so many test biopsies, repeat mammos...waiting for results over the past 2 years that I dont want to do the same with the right side. Its always your choice a very difficult one.  I have to say I dont regret it ! My surgery was Jan 31st expanders were placed at the same time as the mastectomy, it takes time I'm adjusting but healing though I developed a blood clot inmy leg which has slowed me down.  Good luck with your decision I'll keep you in my thoughts and prayers. (I have a 16 yo and 14yo that too helped me with my decision) Laurie
Posts.Title: I'm startng to feel so hopeless! Please help me out! Goldie dhettish
